text: hello hello hello everyone Anthony
Fantan oh here Internet's busiest music
nerd and it's time for he review passion
pit gossamer this is the sophomore LP
from this Massachusetts indie pop
sensation that hit it relatively big in
2008-2009 with a handful of very popular
singles that managed to make it onto
their debut full-length manors and that
LP overall featured a lot of dance beats
really prominent synthesizers sweet
songwriting catchy hooks and a really
strong falsetto vocal coming from
frontman Michael Angelico's and to be
completely honest I never really got
into this LP never really quite got this
album for one I just thought there was
so much indie pop released that year
that that was more enjoyable like from
st. Vincent the panes being pure at
heart girls
Phoenix and and Mika Chu and in
comparison with those artists even
Phoenix to me Passion Pit feels just way
too just friendly I just don't feel like
Passion Pit was offering me much in the
way of adventure I do feel like the band
was kind of ambitious with some of its
instrumentation and how they composed
instruments around their pop songs I
also liked how they would experiment a
bit with vocal samples in their tracks
too but the really ultra sweet attitude
and the whoa-ohh choruses just kind of
killed it for me
and you know I'm not against happy music
I'm really not if it comes off feeling
kind of natural or organic but this LP
and just passion pit in general to me
just has the feeling of just forcing
happiness as hard as possible it's like
a happiness dictatorship or just like
being in a cult where every single
member is staring at you like
see it gets creepy after a while and to
be honest on manners Angelico's fall
said it was really grading on my ears
there are so many points on this LP
where he just does not feel in control
of his falsetto vocal and yet he
continues to sing in that register even
though he's kind of weaving in and out
of pitch I just don't really get much
from him as a vocalist but I still do
admire the band's unrelenting devotion
to all sounds sugary it's playful music
and I do like playful music but but I
can't help but feel like Passion Pit
does not want to play as rough as I
usually like to now on gossamer passion
pit is really searching for and finding
new ways to take their usually giddy
sound and style and elevating it to just
astronomical levels there's just way
more space sounds and just sighs overall
with the music on this LP it's just a
really gargantuan presentation with very
vivid colors pushing play on this thing
is like getting instantaneously
teleported to Teletubby land with cotton
candy clouds and then the smiling baby
Sun everything is there and it's not
really the songs I have a huge issue
with it's the aesthetic because for the
most part the songs on here can be
pretty good well composed well written
for one the song love is greed is a
really catchy song and it has a kind of
cleverness to the lyrics there's a nice
structure to this song and a lot of
other songs on this LP which gives every
track a really nice momentum it has its
highs it has its lows however I feel
like I could get into some of these
tracks so much easier if so many of them
were not performed with this chorus
vocal style that just has the the vapid
positivity of like a Christian
after-school special produced in the 90s
but I guess there is a somewhat
interesting juxtaposition happening on
nearly every single one of these songs
you do get in
upbeat sound from the music and from the
vocal delivery - but the lyrics
themselves a lot of times can display
some really personal and emotional
suffering in a way I guess it's great
that Angelico's can take something sad
and kind of find a silver lining in and
make enough beat track about it but
there are some parts where I feel like
passion pits really sweet musical style
makes some of the sadder emotions on
this LP feel kind of ridiculous like the
buildup on the bridge with song carried
away we've all got something to say at
about that point I imagine somebody
cueing the dancing animals and smiling
flowers however there are some parts on
this LP where things are slightly
toned-down and it makes the songs so
much more palatable like a song constant
conversation which is kind of the slow
jam on this LP I really like the groove
and the closer on the song is actually I
think the only legitimate ly sad
sounding track on this album that is
matched pretty well with it's sadder but
on on my way on the hook has a wonderful
chord progression that to me shows that
with this album Passion Pit has become
musically a little more refined and I
feel like the falsetto vocals on this
album have become a little bit more
refined - they're better performed on
this album there's more pitch control on
them as well I can appreciate
improvement like that as well as the
instrumental flourishes that I think are
very colorful throughout these songs -
but still as catchy and as melodic as
some of these songs can be I just don't
connect with a lot of them emotionally I
just find the the attitude the upbeat
attitude on this album to be incredibly
unrealistic even if there is a morsel of
sadness kind of coloring the background
of it so overall as I listen to it again
and again I did end up liking this LP
though not a lot kind of feeling a
decent - strong six on this LP I know a
lot of you guys are crazy for this album
so let me know what you think
it do you love it do you hate it why and
what should I review next remember the
good comment and the great rate but only
the strong subscribe passion pit
gossamer forever
[Music]
[Music]
